image.altText: Close up of a hand typing on a keyboard in a dark room

items.synopsis: The telemarketer collected donations from supporters, with one charity alleging the company retained nine-year-old documents without its knowledge – which would be a breach of the privacy act.

title.children: Cybercriminals publish personal details of thousands of donors to Australian charities on the dark web

image.altText: Hands holding 50, 20 and 10-dollar Australian banknotes fanned out

items.synopsis: Phasing out cash has serious implications for privacy, safety and financial exclusion among marginalised communities.

title.children: Australia's transition to a cashless society is underway — but not everyone wins when we get rid of cash

image.altText: Students in a classroom.

items.synopsis: One in three school students throughout Australia are not meeting minimum numeracy and literacy expectations, and one in 10 are so far behind they need additional support, new NAPLAN data shows.

title.children: Results from a brand new NAPLAN system are in — but the report card shows some familiar trends

image.altText: A man sitting at a desk with his hands clasped together

items.synopsis: The Russian president is facing a potential showdown with western leaders at next month's G20 summit in India, but an international arrest warrant looms large over any of his travel plans.

title.children: Why Vladimir Putin has a 'huge headache' coming next month

image.altText: A cable car which has come partially off it's cable in Pakistan.

items.synopsis: For those living in Pakistan's remote and mountainous regions, local cable cars are an important connection between communities where roads are absent.

title.children: Pakistan's makeshift cable cars are a risky necessity for many

image.altText: People watch as an army soldier slings down from a helicopter among mountains.

items.synopsis: All eight people, seven of them children, have been rescued after being left dangling in a Pakistan cable car 275 metres above a ravine for more than 14 hours.

title.children: 'Safely rescued': Pakistan's PM rejoices as 7 children and teacher saved from dangling cable car

image.altText: Jim Chalmers smiles while standing in front of Parliament House's budget tree

items.synopsis: Dismissing calls for a major tax shake-up, the government intends to continue pursuing incremental reform in what it calls "bite-sized chunks", including its already announced changes to superannuation tax breaks, tobacco excise and the petroleum resource rent tax.

title.children: Sweeping tax reforms ruled out despite growing pressures on federal budget

image.altText: A collection a photos of pregnant women and newborn babies.

items.synopsis: Telehealth is revolutionising medicine in remote areas, but one obstetrician says entrusting the delivery of a baby to "pure luck" in Australia during 2023 "isn't good enough".

title.children: No privacy, no pain relief and no specialist: Mothers traumatised by unplanned telehealth births

image.altText: Wendy Farmer stands in front of her electric vehicle which is parked in her driveway in Gippsland.

items.synopsis: One regional electric vehicle owner says it takes "planning" to reduce range anxiety, while another isn't quite ready to make the long-distance leap.

title.children: Range anxiety should no longer be a problem — so why aren't more people buying EVs in the regions?

image.altText: Donald Trump, wearing a navy suit, holds his red tie down to stop it flapping as he descends airplane stairs

items.synopsis: This morning's news, as it happens.

title.children: First of Trump's co-accused surrenders in Georgia: The latest news with The Loop

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Albanian Police have shown footage of a man being arrested of suspected arson as authorities continue to battle a major wildfire near the town of Lac. In another video from the southern town of Berat, police have shown security camera footage of two men starting a fire. They have also been identified and arrested. "The fire has reached a massive area of pine trees near the town of Lac and this is one of the worst wildfires this year," Interior Minister Taulant Balla has said on social media. Local media showed video of an army helicopter pouring water in the area as a flames could be seen close to houses. Defence Minister Niko Peleshi says 50 soldiers were deployed but stopping the fire remains a challenge because of the difficult terrain. Just in July, Albania has identified and charged 14 people with starting wildfires which is punishable with up to 15 years jail time. Wildfires are also raging in Greece, Spain, Italy and Portugal, as the region suffers hot, dry and windy conditions that scientists have linked to climate change.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Accused arsonists arrested for allegedly setting wildfires in Albania

props.alt: a man in the silhouette of the sun in Albania wildfire

children.content: (Reuters: Florian Goga)
Albanian Police have shown footage of a man being arrested of suspected arson as authorities continue to battle a major wildfire near the town of Lac.
In another video from the southern town of Berat, police have shown security camera footage of two men starting a fire.
They have also been identified and arrested.
"The fire has reached a massive area of pine trees near the town of Lac and this is one of the worst wildfires this year," Interior Minister Taulant Balla has said on social media.
Local media showed video of an army helicopter pouring water in the area as a flames could be seen close to houses.

props.alt: Two firefighters battle a blaze in Kurbin

children.content: (Reuters: Florian Goga)
Defence Minister Niko Peleshi says 50 soldiers were deployed but stopping the fire remains a challenge because of the difficult terrain.
Just in July,
Albania has identified and
charged 14 people
with starting wildfires which is punishable with up to
15 years jail
time.
Wildfires are also raging in Greece, Spain, Italy and Portugal, as the region suffers hot, dry and windy conditions that scientists have linked to climate change.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The first of Donald Trump's co-defendants in Georgia's criminal case accusing the former US president and his associates of subverting his 2020 election loss have surrendered at an Atlanta jail. Trump's former lawyer John Eastman and Republican poll watcher Scott Hall both surrendered to the county sheriff's office, two days before Trump himself is set to turn himself in to face his fourth criminal indictment this year. Eastman is agreeing to a $US100,000 bond agreement. "My legal team and I will vigorously contest every count of the indictment in which I have been named and also every count in which others are named," he says. "I am confident that when the law is faithfully applied in this proceeding, all of my co-defendents and I will be fully vindicated." He says he does not regret attaching himself to the former president. Hall, a Republican poll watcher in Georgia's Fulton County, is in jail after being booked by the county sheriff's office. Hall previously agreed to a $US10,000 bond deal requiring that he report to pre-trial supervision every 30 days.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: First co-defendants in Donald Trump fraud election case surrender at Georgia jail

props.alt: A sign that says fulton county jail

children.content: Fulton County Jail in Georgia
(Reuters: Dustin Chambers)
The first of Donald Trump's co-defendants in Georgia's criminal case
accusing the former US president and his associates of subverting his 2020 election loss
have surrendered at an Atlanta jail.

Trump's former lawyer John Eastman and Republican poll watcher Scott Hall both surrendered to the county sheriff's office, two days before Trump himself is set to turn himself in to face his fourth criminal indictment this year.
Eastman is agreeing to a $US100,000 bond agreement.
"My legal team and I will vigorously contest every count of the indictment in which I have been named and also every count in which others are named," he says.
"I am confident that when the law is faithfully applied in this proceeding, all of my co-defendents and I will be fully vindicated."
He says he does not regret attaching himself to the former president.
Hall, a Republican poll watcher in Georgia's Fulton County, is in jail after being booked by the county sheriff's office.
Hall previously agreed to a $US10,000 bond deal requiring that he report to pre-trial supervision every 30 days.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Here are some of this morning's latest stories: Donald Trump's election attorney says he and the former president will be 'fully vindicated' as he surrenders in Georgia Albanian police arrest suspected arsonists who allegedly started ongoing and out of control wildfires Greece fires burn for fourth day as the death toll reaches 18 8 people have been rescued after being left in a dangling Pakistan cable care for more than 14 hours One in three students aren't meeting numeracy and literacy expectations, NAPLAN results show The deatils of thousands of donors to Australian charities have been leaked to dark web
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Welcome to The Loop for Wednesday, August 23

children.content: Here are some of this morning's latest stories:
Donald Trump's election attorney says he and the former president will be 'fully vindicated' as he surrenders in Georgia

death toll reaches
8 people have

One in three students
aren't meeting numeracy and literacy expectations

The deatils of thousands of donors to Australian charities
have been leaked to dark web

image.altText: A young woman sits up on a stretcher

items.synopsis: A 23-year-old bank teller caught up in a siege inspired the psychological term Stockholm syndrome. But 50 years later, experts say Kristin's story is totally misunderstood.

title.children: 'I know my story. I know my truth': The woman behind Stockholm Syndrome says it's all a lie

image.altText: A woman with bold glasses sits at a table.

items.synopsis: The federal government says the "door is open" to sign its $13-billion Murray-Darling Basin Plan, but there's no indication so far Victoria wants to walk through.

title.children: Unity in Murray-Darling Basin fractures as Vic refuses to sign onto new plan

image.altText: A composite photo zooming in on a small, white fish with hands.

items.synopsis: A species of fish not seen since the Macarena was top of the pop charts is believed to have been spotted in deep waters off Tasmania — and scientists say it could be a symptom of the warming waters effect on species distribution.

title.children: Is this a rare walking fish not seen in 27 years? Scientists think it is

image.altText: A mother with her three children.

items.synopsis: Aspasia Paspaliaris says she was not surprised when doctors revealed her daughter's cochlear implant wasn't working properly.

title.children: 'My heart breaks': Mother describes stress of daughter's incorrectly mapped cochlear implant

image.altText: Officer in blue uniform speaking to a man in military uniform and a local in plain clothes.

items.synopsis: Police authorise the use of "lethal force" in Papua New Guinea and the prime minister proposes new laws — carrying terms of life imprisonment — in response to tribal violence gripping the nation's highlands that has left dozens dead in recent weeks.

title.children: PNG has been rocked by tribal violence for weeks. Police have now been authorised to use 'lethal force'

image.altText: Wildfires in western Canada continue to force thousands to evacuate homes

items.synopsis: Canada’s record-breaking wildfires are significantly worse because of climate change, according to a rapid analysis by a leading team of scientists.

title.children: 'Unprecedented' Canadian wildfires made worse by climate change, scientists find

image.altText: A dark, large and empty sewer system underground, with some sewerage running through it

items.synopsis: Eight members of a tour group exploring underground tunnels in Moscow's sewer system are found dead following flash flooding.

title.children: Eight people die in Moscow sewer when flash flooding hits tour group

image.altText: A man stands in a suit and bow tie.

items.synopsis: The remains of 69-year-old Tomislav Nemes were discovered after out-of-state relatives called the police to ask for a welfare check to be done at his home.

title.children: Man charged with murder over decomposed body kept in house for 12 months

image.altText: Colour photo of Crispin Dye smiling and playing a guitar in an undated photo

items.synopsis: Crispin Dye, a former manager of the Australian rock band, died 30 years ago after he was found in Sydney with severe head injuries.

title.children: DNA test of AC/DC manager's bloody jeans provides new person of interest over his death 30 years ago

image.altText: exterior of ballarat clarendon college with sign

items.synopsis: The video, captured during an online class with year 12 students, includes audio of the teacher yelling and swearing while providing feedback on student English essays.

title.children: Teacher at top Victorian private school resigns after expletive-filled rant shared on social media

image.altText: A black-and-white photo of a young army soldier in the 1970s.

items.synopsis: Lieutenant Colonel Harry Smith SG MC, the most esteemed commander of Australia's bloodiest battle of the Vietnam War, has died in his Buderim home on Queensland's Sunshine Coast.

title.children: Legendary Long Tan veteran Lieutenant Colonel Harry Smith dies, aged 90

image.altText: A selfie shot of a young Caucasian woman with blonde hair, outside in the savannah with an elephant and two rangers behind her.

items.synopsis: Warren's family have long-argued her death was the result of foul play, but no charges have ever been laid by Mozambique police.

title.children: Nearly seven years after Elly Warren's death in Mozambique, a coronial inquest tries to find answers

image.altText: A black and white image supposedly portraying the Loch Ness Monster

items.synopsis: In what is being touted as the largest search for "Nessie" in 50 years, Loch Ness monster enthusiasts are expected to flock to the Scottish Highlands this weekend to search for the mythical beast.

title.children: Hundreds expected to flock to Loch Ness in search of mythical creature

image.altText: Filipino marines standing on the deck of a rusty ship.

items.synopsis: As Philippine Navy ships kept watch, coast guard vessels escorted supply boats to the handful of troops stationed on the crumbling warship.

title.children: Philippines successfully resupplies its contentious South China Sea outpost

image.altText: A Thai man smiling in a crowd

items.synopsis: Thailand's parliament has chosen a new prime minister after three months of deadlock. Political newcomer and property tycoon Srettha Thavisin will lead the nation.

title.children: Property tycoon Srettha Thavisin becomes Thai Prime Minister

image.altText: A still from a social media video showing an 18-year-old man being arrested in Taree.

items.synopsis: The aunt of an Indigenous teen whose arrest is under an internal police investigation has lodged an official complaint with the police watchdog.

title.children: Family calls for 'justice' following 'shocking' arrest of young Indigenous man

image.altText: The Gabba redevelopment north-eastern view ahead of the 2023 Brisbane Olympic Games, stadium in background fans in foreground

items.synopsis: The multi-billion-dollar redevelopment of the Gabba stadium in Brisbane, which will see a heritage-listed school knocked down, was not necessary to host the 2032 Olympic Games, Australian Olympic Committee CEO reveals.

title.children: 'Not actually required': AOC boss questioned over $2.7 billion decision to rebuild the Gabba

image.altText: A close up of Cortnee looking serious on the pitch.

items.synopsis: After writing her name into Australian sporting folklore with her ice-cool penalty at the Women's World Cup, Matildas star Cortnee Vine is set to continue thrilling local crowds after extending her contract with Sydney FC.

title.children: 'A real coup': Matildas World Cup hero re-signs with A-League Women champions

image.altText: A Russian bomber engulfed in flames at an airbase

items.synopsis: Images posted on social media show a Russian supersonic bomber engulfed in flames following a drone strike.

title.children: Ukrainian drone destroys Russian supersonic bomber
